meanings.definition: The process of introducing market principles or mechanisms into a system or sector.
meanings.sent1: The marketizations of the healthcare industry led to increased competition among hospitals.
meanings.sent2: Global marketizations have influenced the way countries trade with each other.
meanings.sent3: During the meeting, the discussion on marketizations turned into a lively debate.
meanings.sent4: The marketizations in the technology sector are like a wave of change sweeping through the industry.
meanings.sent5: Her presentation on marketizations was so clear that everyone understood the concept easily.

meanings.definition: The act of making something more market-oriented or competitive.
meanings.sent1: Marketizations in the fashion industry have led to new trends emerging rapidly.
meanings.sent2: The company's marketizations improved its sales performance in the last quarter.
meanings.sent3: The marketizations of the school cafeteria menu made lunchtime more exciting for students.
meanings.sent4: Her innovative marketizations transformed the small business into a thriving enterprise.
meanings.sent5: The marketizations of the sports industry created opportunities for athletes to showcase their talents.
